meanings.definition: To cover or mark with chalk.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys bechalking the sidewalk with colorful drawings.
meanings.sent2: The teacher bechalked the blackboard with important notes.
meanings.sent3: The kids bechalking the driveway turned it into a vibrant art gallery.
meanings.sent4: The artist bechalking the canvas brought it to life with intricate designs.
meanings.sent5: Bechalking the fence made it look brand new and clean.

meanings.definition: To write or draw with chalk.
meanings.sent1: He bechalked his name on the board to claim his spot.
meanings.sent2: The children bechalked their favorite animals on the pavement.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat bechalking on the wall left a trail of paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bechalking the mural transformed the dull wall into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Bechalking the menu on the board made it easy for everyone to see.

meanings.definition: To decorate or outline with chalk.
meanings.sent1: They bechalked the stage for the play with festive designs.
meanings.sent2: The artist bechalked the border of the artwork for a unique touch.
meanings.sent3: The chef bechalking the cake added a whimsical touch to the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The florist bechalking the wedding aisle created a magical pathway.
meanings.sent5: Bechalking the borders of the garden path made it stand out beautifully.
